title.narrative: INSTITUTION PROTECTION OF CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: Institutions that guarantee the protection of children and adolescents as well as response to and the restitution of rights have strengthened capacities to prevent and provide assistance regarding violence, abuse and exploitation of the most vulnerable children and adolescents., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, will grow up in a protective environment that fosters the restitution of rights against all types of violence, abuse and exploitation

participating-org.narrative: GRACCN GOBIERNO REGIONAL AUTONOMO D COSTA CARIBE NORTE
MINISTERIO DE LA FAMILIA ADOLESCENCIA Y NINEZ

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Institutions that guarantee the protection of children and adolescents as well as response to and the restitution of rights havestrengthened capacities to prevent and provide assistance regarding violence, abuse and exploitation of the most vulnerablechildren and adolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF strengthened MIFAN in the matter of substitute homes, the appropriation of the "Comprehensive Care Protocol for children and adolescents who are victims of sexual violence" and in the updating of the Route of Access to Justice for Children and Women on the North Caribbean Coast. Dissemination of the "Actions Protocol for the Repatriation of National and Foreign Children and Adolescents in situations of irregular migration" to officials of the Social Welfare System. The CO contributed to conducting studies with the IML, and improving knowledge about family criminal justice and adolescents with the CSJ. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022
